meanings.definition: The quality or state of being intermittent.
meanings.sent1: The intermittency of the rain showers made planning the picnic difficult.
meanings.sent2: The intermittency of the internet connection caused frustration among the users.
meanings.sent3: The intermittency of the cat's purring was quite amusing as it seemed to turn on and off randomly.
meanings.sent4: The intermittency of the streetlights gave the neighborhood an eerie, flickering glow.
meanings.sent5: The intermittency of the car engine's rumble made it hard to predict when it would start.

meanings.sent1: She studied the intermittency of the flickering light with curiosity.
meanings.sent2: The intermittency of the wind made the windmill's rotation irregular.
meanings.sent3: The intermittency of the clock's ticking was oddly entertaining to listen to.
meanings.sent4: The intermittency of the applause indicated a divided audience.
meanings.sent5: The intermittency of the waves crashing against the shore created a soothing rhythm.

meanings.sent1: The intermittency of the power supply in the old building was a constant issue.
meanings.sent2: The intermittency of his attention span made it hard for him to focus on one task for long.
meanings.sent3: The intermittency of the traffic lights seemed to be playing a game of red light, green light.
meanings.sent4: The intermittency of the music playing in the distance added a mysterious vibe to the night.
meanings.sent5: The intermittency of the phone signal in the mountains made communication unreliable.
